questions.clue: In 1925, this famous trial, also known as the 'Scopes Monkey Trial', debated teaching evolution in Tennessee schools.
This trial saw baseball great Barry Bonds controversially charged with perjury related to steroid use.
In 1995, this former football star's trial for the murder of Nicole Brown Simpson gripped America.
In 1994, former NBA star Jayson Williams was involved in a trial over his role in a fatal shooting at his home.
In 1633, this scientist was tried by the Inquisition for defending the heliocentric model of the universe.

categories.name: Slam Dunk Literature: Basketball in Books

questions.clue: In Jerry Spinelli's novel 'Maniac Magee', this sport helps bridge racial divides in the small Pennsylvania town.
In Walter Dean Myers' young adult novel 'Slam!', the protagonist Greg Harris is determined to succeed on the court despite challenges off it.
Kwame Alexander's verse novel 'The Crossover' tells the story of twins Josh and JB Bell who face changes on and off the basketball court.
This memoir by NBA legend Kareem Abdul-Jabbar explores how his passion for basketball was intertwined with his exploration of social justice and activism.
In John Feinstein's book 'The Last Amateurs', this NCAA basketball division is highlighted for its lack of professional allure yet high level of competition.
For 200 points: This player was the first to hit more than 60 home runs in a single season, doing so in 1927.
For 400 points: Known as 'Hammerin' Hank,' this player broke Babe Ruth's career home run record in 1974.
For 600 points: This historic game in 1995 marked the end of an era for this stadium, leaving its team to move across the state.
For 800 points: This athlete was the first African American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era, debuting with the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947.
For 1000 points: This pitcher achieved his 300th win on July 15, 2008, a milestone reached by only 24 pitchers in MLB history.
Known for flying too close to the sun, this character used wings made of feathers and wax.
In Greek mythology, this creature has the body of a man and the head of a bull, and was kept in the Labyrinth.
Norse legend speaks of this colossal serpent that encircles Midgard and is destined to fight Thor during Ragnarok.
In Chinese mythology, this creature is a symbol of power, strength, and good luck, often associated with the emperor.
This fire-breathing creature from Greek mythology, slain by Bellerophon, is a lion with a goat's head protruding from its back.

categories.name: The Art of Music: Instruments Across Cultures

questions.clue: This string instrument names include 'classical' when played in orchestras and can vary in size from child to adult.
Originating from Australia, this wind instrument was traditionally made from eucalyptus and is known for its deep droning sound.
Widely used in Indian classical music, this pair of small drums is played with the fingers and palms.
In the Javanese and Balinese cultures of Indonesia, this ensemble features metallophones, xylophones, and drums.
This ancient Greek instrument, a sort of predecessor to the oboe, consists of a double-reed pipe often depicted in mythology.

final.clue: This player, known for breaking the color barrier in Major League Baseball in 1947, also played for the UCLA Bruins in football, basketball, track and field.
